tutorial.title: Online Resume
tutorial.descriptionContent: Build a shareable online resume where you use lists to showcase your experience and coding prowess

executableContent.instructions:
Let's build a simple online resume to impress future employers.

We'll start by adding a title to the document to communicate that we are building a resume.

1. Add a `title` element containing the text `Resume` to the `head` element of `index.html`.

Let's now add some content to the `body` of our page.

1. Add a first-level heading with the text `Sandra Austin` to create a heading with the name of the person to whom the resume belongs.
2. Then add a second-level heading with the text `Coding Rockstar` to create an attention-grabbing headline.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: First and second level headings are creating using `<h1>` and `<h2>` tags, respectively.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's now add a portrait to the resume. 

1. Create an `img` element under `h2`.
2. Set the `src` attribute to `/img/portrait-cv.png` or to a web address of a picture of yourself.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: If you are using your own photo, be sure to use the absolute URL (i.e., the full path address, starting with `http://`.)

executableContent.instructions:
Let's now start building out the substance of our resume. 

1. Create a `div` element to contain a new section of content.
2. Within the new `div` , add a third level heading with the text `Relevant Experience` to create a subheading for the resume.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Third level headings are created using `<h3>` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's start building out the relevant experience section.

1. Create an unordered list under the `h3` you just created.
2. Create at least three list items, each containing a job title and company name (e.g. Software Engineer - Eddison, Marketing Agent - Musky Ads, etc.).
3. Add line breaks between each list item.

files.name: index.html
files.solvedContent:
Sandra Austin

Coding Rockstar

Relevant Experience

  • Software Engineer - Eddison

  • Marketing Agent - Musky Ads

  • Marketing Intern - Musky Ads

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Your code should look something like this:

```HTML 
<unordered list>
    <list item>Software Engineer - Eddison</list item>
    <break>
    <list item>Marketing Agent - Musky Ads</list item>
    <break>
    <list item>Marketing Intern - Musky Ads</list item>
   </unordered list>
```

executableContent.instructions:
Below each of the job title and company list items, let's create a numbered list to further describe the details of each job.

1. After the text (but before the closing tag) of each list item in our unordered list, add the opening and closing tags necessary to create an ordered list.
2. Within each ordered list element, add at least two list items, each containing a key experience for that job (e.g., "Worked on software for autonomous vehicles." or "Team lead for 1 year.")

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Sandra Austin

Coding Rockstar

Relevant Experience

  • Software Engineer - Eddison

  • Marketing Agent - Musky Ads

  • Marketing Intern - Musky Ads
files.solvedContent:
Sandra Austin

Coding Rockstar

Relevant Experience

  • Software Engineer - Eddison
    1. Worked on software for autonomous vehicles.
    2. Team lead for 1 year.

  • Marketing Agent - Musky Ads
    1. Worked on marketing campaigns for SpaceX.
    2. Managed a team of 10 people for 2 years.

  • Marketing Intern - Musky Ads
    1. Assisted with marketing campaigns for SpaceABC.
    2. Managed the calendar for a team of 10 people.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Each job listed should be structured something like this:

```HTML
<list item>Software Engineer - Eddison
    <ordered list>
       <list item>Worked on software for autonomous vehicles.</list item>
       <list item>Team lead for 1 year.</list item>
    </ordered list>
 </list item>
```

executableContent.instructions: Let's now create a new section to link to a few interesting recent projects. 1. Under the first `div`, create a *sibling* `div` element to contain a new section of content. This div follows the layout of our `Relevant Experience` section. 2. Within the new `div`, add an `h3` element as a child. Give the heading the text `Recent Projects` to create a subheading for the section. 3. Create an unordered list that contains three list items. 4. Add a link to a project within each list item (e.g., `Space Invaders Emulator` )

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Sandra Austin

Coding Rockstar

Relevant Experience

  • Software Engineer - Eddison
    1. Worked on software for autonomous vehicles.
    2. Team lead for 1 year.

  • Marketing Agent - Musky Ads
    1. Worked on marketing campaigns for SpaceX.
    2. Managed a team of 10 people for 2 years.

  • Marketing Intern - Musky Ads
    1. Assisted with marketing campaigns for SpaceABC.
    2. Managed the calendar for a team of 10 people.
files.solvedContent:
Sandra Austin

Coding Rockstar

Relevant Experience

  • Software Engineer - Eddison
    1. Worked on software for autonomous vehicles.
    2. Team lead for 1 year.

  • Marketing Agent - Musky Ads
    1. Worked on marketing campaigns for SpaceX.
    2. Managed a team of 10 people for 2 years.

  • Marketing Intern - Musky Ads
    1. Assisted with marketing campaigns for SpaceABC.
    2. Managed the calendar for a team of 10 people.

Recent Projects

  • Space Invaders Emulator
  • Rocket Ship Trajectory Simulator
  • Habitable Planet Search Algorithm

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Check over all of your nested elements and don't forget to close elements properly using closing tags!
